  • Method Details

    • implementersOf

      @Nonnull public Set<ClassType> implementersOf(@Nonnull ClassType interfaceType)
      Description copied from interface: TypeHierarchy
      Returns all classes that implement the specified interface. This is transitive: If class A extends B and B implements interface, then this method will return both A and B as implementers of interfaceType.

      This includes interfaces extending interfaceType as they may contain default implementations of methods.

      Specified by:
      implementersOf in interface TypeHierarchy

    • subclassesOf

      @Nonnull public Set<ClassType> subclassesOf(@Nonnull ClassType classType)
      Description copied from interface: TypeHierarchy
      Returns all classes that extend the specified class. This is transitive: If A extends B and B extends classType, then this method will return both A and B as extenders of classType.
      Specified by:
      subclassesOf in interface TypeHierarchy

    • subtypesOf

      @Nonnull public Set<ClassType> subtypesOf(@Nonnull ClassType type)
      Description copied from interface: TypeHierarchy
      For an interface type, this does the same as TypeHierarchy.implementersOf(ClassType). For a class type, this does the same as TypeHierarchy.subclassesOf(ClassType).
      Specified by:
      subtypesOf in interface TypeHierarchy

    • directSubtypesOf

      @Nonnull public Set<ClassType> directSubtypesOf(@Nonnull ClassType type)
      Description copied from interface: TypeHierarchy
      Returns the direct implementers of an interface or direct subclasses of a class.
      Specified by:
      directSubtypesOf in interface TypeHierarchy

    • directSuperClassOf

      @Nullable @Deprecated public ClassType directSuperClassOf(@Nonnull ClassType classType)
      Deprecated.
      method exists for completeness - superClassOf() / which is basically SootClass.getSuperClass() should be more performant.

    • implementedInterfacesOf

      @Nonnull public Set<ClassType> implementedInterfacesOf(@Nonnull ClassType type)
      Description copied from interface: TypeHierarchy
      Returns the interfaces implemented by type if it is a class or extended by type if it is an interface. This includes interfaces implemented by superclasses and also covers the case where classType directly or indirectly implements an interface I1 that extends another interface I2 . I2 will be considered an implemented interface of classType.
      Specified by:
      implementedInterfacesOf in interface TypeHierarchy

    • superClassOf

      @Nullable public ClassType superClassOf(@Nonnull ClassType classType)
      Description copied from interface: TypeHierarchy
      Returns the direct superclass of classType. If classType == java.lang.Object , this method returns null.
      Specified by:
      superClassOf in interface TypeHierarchy

      Specified by:

    • addType

      public void addType(@Nonnull SootClass sootClass)
      Description copied from interface: MutableTypeHierarchy
      Adds the type to the hierarchy, updating all structures to reflect its presence as if it had been a member of the hierarchy from the beginning.

      For internal use only.

      Specified by:
      addType in interface MutableTypeHierarchy
